body:
As others have alluded to, it is NOT a good idea to share Excel resources. If you REALLY want to do this, you can try to share the Workbook.

http://www.excel-easy.com/examples/share-workbooks.html

Eventually, though, this will cause corruption. A better idea is to use Access for shared needs (split and share your Access database).

https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Ways-to-share-an-Access-database-2c24eb08-bee1-453e-be8e-455f847c5c74

Or, better, use SQL Server, and a ASP.NET user interface. This is probably way beyond where you are now, but you could certainly learn the nuts and bolts of these technologies, and get up to speed with these kinds of things pretty quickly. You should always try to use the best tool for the job.
title: two people one excel file
